intro: Capnoides melanochlora, commonly known as the black-leaved capnoid, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its dark green, often glossy leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to black as they mature. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
